intro: Leptodaphne pseudopsychotria, commonly known as the false psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the island's diverse ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
